alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 12:56PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lehigh and west central Northampton Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Northampton, or 7 miles north of Allentown, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bethlehem, Northampton, Bath, Walnutport, Steuben, Beersville, Catasauqua, Coplay, North Catasauqua, Chapman, Hokendauqua and Fullerton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania.
